name: Rose Milk
history: Rose Milk is a popular flavored milk beverage in India, known for its refreshing and aromatic qualities. It's a traditional drink made by blending milk with rose syrup, giving it a distinctive pink color and a floral flavor.
description: Rose Milk is a sweet, creamy, and floral beverage made with chilled milk and rose syrup. It's often enjoyed as a cooling drink on hot days or as a delightful dessert beverage. The drink is visually appealing due to its vibrant pink hue.

instructions.title: Mix Ingredients
instructions.description: In a glass, combine the chilled milk and rose syrup. Stir well.

instructions.title: Sweeten
instructions.description: Add sugar to taste and stir until it's completely dissolved. Adjust the amount of rose syrup and sugar according to your preference.

instructions.title: Serve Chilled
instructions.description: Add ice cubes to the glass for an extra chilled drink. Serve immediately.

tips: Use full-fat milk for a creamier texture, or opt for skim milk for a lighter version.
Homemade rose syrup can be used for a more natural flavor.
variations: Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a richer dessert drink.
Garnish with dried rose petals or pistachios for an elegant touch.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Store in the refrigerator and stir well before serving.

presentationTips: Serve in a tall glass with a straw for easy sipping.
Garnish with a fresh rose petal on top for a decorative touch.
